item.title: Benchmarking GPU sharing strategies in Kubernetes
item.description: Benchmarking This writeup is the conclusion of my previous post. If you don’t know what MIG, MPS and Time Slicing do, I’d suggest reading that one first. Before talking about the results, there’s one thing worth calling out in Pytorch’s notes on CUDA: By default, GPU operations are asynchronous. When you call a function that uses the GPU, the operations are enqueued to the particular device, but not necessarily executed until later.
